page.title: 07PORT OF MENTEITH TOURISM
page.content: We went to visit Lochend House and interviewed Mr Nairn, the present owner about the chalets he has built in the grounds. Lochend House is over 100yrs old and is on the southern shore of the Lake. Mr Nairn started in 1973 with 10 chalets which cost Â£5000 each.He now has 14 and each would cost Â£30,000 to build today. When full 90 people can be accomodated and they are usually fully booked from May to September. About 5% of the 2000 guests come from overseas. The low % of foreigners is due to the fact that the English people book their holidays from November to January whereas the Europeans do not do so until March or April.At the peak season it costs Â£185-Â£200+VAT PER WEEK.VAT is charged at 15% at present.
